emails.subject: Re: mapping urea
emails.to: Saber Khalfallah; Skander Ghamgui; Elfi Middelbeek; Dnext Lineups; Support Dnext
emails.cc: Amine Saidi; Pierre Goffinet; Benoit Baliguet; Louis Olive
emails.body_text:
Hello, 

Will works or, in a simpler way, you can use Reapply Mapping if those were mapped incorrectly before and didn’t come from static values.
Using Reapply Mapping is easier, and you don’t need to be a Reference Manager to do it, unlike the solution provided by Saber.
________________________________

From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Sent: 13 November 2025 16:31
To: Skander Ghamgui <skander.ghamgui@dnext.io>; Elfi Middelbeek <elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io>; Dnext Lineups <lineups@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>; Louis Olive <louis.olive@dnext.io>; Pierre Goffinet <pierre.goffinet@dnext.io>; Nicolas Chaperon <nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io>; Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>
Cc: Amine Saidi <amine.saidi@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: mapping urea 
 

Hello Elfi,

 

To achieve what you want, I would first need to:

1.	Edit the product reference with the code UREA and change the name from “FERTDU” to “Urea.”
2.	Use Reference Management > Correction to replace the following reference:

	*	Name: Urea
	*	Code: FERTDU
		with the first one.

However, I'm not completely sure if this will work as expected or if it could cause issues.

And i’m not sure if it’s going to work and not cause issues.

Adding @Louis Olive <mailto:louis.olive@dnext.io>  & @Pierre Goffinet <mailto:pierre.goffinet@dnext.io> 

 

@Nicolas Chaperon <mailto:nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io> @Benoit Baliguet <mailto:benoit.baliguet@dnext.io> 


Please let me know if the steps I mentioned could adress Elfi’s request and not cause any issues.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Avenue Louis-Casaï 81 | CH-1216 Cointrin

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/> 

 

 

From: Skander Ghamgui <skander.ghamgui@dnext.io> 
Sent: Thursday, November 13, 2025 15:58
To: Elfi Middelbeek <elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io>; Dnext Lineups <lineups@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>; Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Cc: Amine Saidi <amine.saidi@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: mapping urea

 

@Saber Khalfallah <mailto:saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>  kind reminder

 

 

Skander Ghamgui

Data Analyst, Trade Flow team

                                                                                                     skander.ghamgui@dnext.io <mailto:skander.ghamgui@dnext.io> 



 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Kalaa Kebira 4060 | Sousse

info@dnext.io <mailto:info@dnext.io>  | www.dnext.io <http://www.dnext.io/> 

 

________________________________

From: Elfi Middelbeek <elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io <mailto:elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io> >
Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2025 10:26 AM
To: Dnext Lineups <lineups@dnext.io <mailto:lineups@dnext.io> >; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io <mailto:support@dnext.io> >
Subject: mapping urea 

 

Hi all,

 

So I’ve found some issues with the mapping of urea – see two codes below:

 

Mapping issue found : 

Correct:
Name : Urea
Code : FERTDU

 

Wrong:
Name : FERTDU
Code : Urea

 

However, the second issue is that with the correct mapping it shows FERTDU as product on the platform – but clients will not know this is urea unless we tell them. So it would be better to change it to Name: Urea and Code: UREA – but how easy is this and can we change everything over then so there are no issues?

 

Thank you!

 

All the best,

 

Elfi

 

 

Elfi Middelbeek

+41 77 267 1175

Head of Fertilizer Analysis
emails.body_html:
Hello, 

Will works or, in a simpler way, you can use Reapply Mapping if those were mapped incorrectly before and didn’t come from static values.
Using Reapply Mapping is easier, and you don’t need to be a Reference Manager to do it, unlike the solution provided by Saber.
From: Saber Khalfallah <saber.khalfallah@dnext.io>
Sent: 13 November 2025 16:31
To: Skander Ghamgui <skander.ghamgui@dnext.io>; Elfi Middelbeek <elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io>; Dnext Lineups <lineups@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>; Louis Olive <louis.olive@dnext.io>; Pierre Goffinet <pierre.goffinet@dnext.io>; Nicolas Chaperon <nicolas.chaperon@dnext.io>; Benoit Baliguet <benoit.baliguet@dnext.io>
Cc: Amine Saidi <amine.saidi@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: mapping urea
 

Hello Elfi,

 

To achieve what you want, I would first need to:

  1. Edit the product reference with the code UREA and change the name from “FERTDU” to “Urea.”
  2. Use Reference Management > Correction to replace the following reference:
    • Name: Urea
    • Code: FERTDU
      with the first one.

However, I'm not completely sure if this will work as expected or if it could cause issues.

And i’m not sure if it’s going to work and not cause issues.

Adding @Louis Olive & @Pierre Goffinet

 

@Nicolas Chaperon@Benoit Baliguet


Please let me know if the steps I mentioned could adress Elfi’s request and not cause any issues.

 

Best regards,

Saber Khalfallah

Customer Support

                                                                                                     saber.khalfallah@dnext.io

@Saber Khalfallah kind reminder

 

 

Skander Ghamgui

                                                                                                     skander.ghamgui@dnext.io

 

 

DNEXT INTELLIGENCE SA | Kalaa Kebira 4060 | Sousse

info@dnext.io | www.dnext.io

 

From: Elfi Middelbeek <elfi.middelbeek@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2025 10:26 AM
To: Dnext Lineups <lineups@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: mapping urea

 

Hi all,

 

So I’ve found some issues with the mapping of urea – see two codes below:

 

Mapping issue found : 

Correct:
Name : Urea
Code : FERTDU

 

Wrong:
Name : FERTDU
Code : Urea

 

However, the second issue is that with the correct mapping it shows FERTDU as product on the platform – but clients will not know this is urea unless we tell them. So it would be better to change it to Name: Urea and Code: UREA – but how easy is this and can we change everything over then so there are no issues?

 

Thank you!

 

All the best,

 

Elfi

 

 

Elfi Middelbeek

+41 77 267 1175

Head of Fertilizer Analysis
